intro: Chondrosum oligostachyum, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in mountainous areas with high humidity. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
